meanings.definition: To separate or decompose a compound by passing an electric current through it.
meanings.sent1: I will electrolyse water to obtain hydrogen and oxygen.
meanings.sent2: Scientists electrolyse salt to produce chlorine gas.
meanings.sent3: The mad scientist tried to electrolyse a banana, hoping for a potassium explosion.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to electrolyse the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The electric current danced through the solution, ready to electrolyse the molecules.

meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical change through the action of an electric current.
meanings.sent1: The metal will electrolyse when exposed to the battery.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the solution began to electrolyse, creating bubbles.
meanings.sent3: The cookie dough seemed to electrolyse in the oven, turning into delicious cookies.
meanings.sent4: His ideas seemed to electrolyse the stagnant project, bringing new life to it.
meanings.sent5: The lightning storm appeared to electrolyse the night sky, illuminating it with flashes of light.
